snippet: Robert Irwin’s installation “Scrim Veil — Black Rectangle — Natural Light,” last seen on the Whitney Museum’s fourth floor in 1977, will be back through Sept. 1.
abstract: Robert Irwin installation Scrim Veil — Black Rectangle — Natural Light, last seen at Whitney Museum in 1977, will be resurrected in June as part of rolling goodbye to museum's residence in Marcel Breuer building; installation, radical experiment in perception and dialing art down to almost nothing, features translucent polyester scrim bisecting open space.
lead_paragraph: Robert Irwin’s installation “Scrim Veil — Black Rectangle — Natural Light,” last seen on the Whitney Museum’s fourth floor in 1977, will be back through Sept. 1.

headline.main: Back at the Whitney, Tinkering With Perception
headline.print_headline: Back at the Whitney, Tinkering With Perception
